alert.note: Alert for Carroll (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 4:16PM EST until December 19 at 8:17PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Hampshire...Maine... Saco River At Conway affecting Oxford, Cumberland and Carroll Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saco River at Conway. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Major flooding occurs in Conway and North Conway. Flood waters come up to properties off West Side Road in Conway Village. Transvale Acres severely impacted with flood water several feet deep. Permanent buildings on area campgrounds become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM EST Monday the stage was 13.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 15.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to 4.9 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will rise to 5.7 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
